content.text: Connect the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1. E, F, G and H are crocodile clips
Using the long connecting lead, clip crocodile clips F and G on the resistance wire so that they are approximately \(0.45 \text{m}\) apart
The length of resistance wire between F and G is x. Measure and record x
The current in the circuit is \(I\). Close S and record \(I\)
Open S
Change \(x\) and record \(x\) and \(I\)
Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(x\) and \(I\)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\frac{1}{I}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{I}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(x\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =
y-intercept =

[Total: 20]
In this experiment, you will investigate an electrical circuit
• You are provided with two lengths of plastic pipe
• Select one of them and, using the waterproof pen, label one end A
• Make a mark approximately 12 cm from end A, as shown in Fig. 2.1
• The distance from end A to the mark is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 2.1
Measure and record \(L\)
• Use the thermometer to measure the room temperature \(T_0\). Record \(T_0\)
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2
The point Z is the lower edge of the end of the wooden strip
· The distance from the bench to Z is \(H_{1}\) , as shown in Fig. 2.2
Measure and record \(H_{1}\)
· Slowly and carefully pour very hot water into the measuring cylinder until the water level reaches the mark on the pipe
The distance between the bench and Z will change. When Z reaches its lowest position the new distance from the bench to Z is \(H_{2}\)
Measure and record \(H_{2}\)
· The temperature of the water in the measuring cylinder is \(T\)
Measure and record \(T\)
· Calculate \(H_{1} - H_{2}\)
· Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(H_{1} - H_{2}\)
Show your working
· Calculate \(\Delta L\) where \(\Delta L = \frac{s(H_1 - H_2)}{d}\)
Remove the pipe from the measuring cylinder and empty the water into the beaker
• Select the other pipe and label one end of this pipe B. Make a mark approximately \(19 \text{cm}\) from end B
• Measure and record the value of \(L\) for this pipe
• Place this pipe in the measuring cylinder as shown in Fig. 2.2
• Ensure that end B is at the bottom of the measuring cylinder
• Repeat (b)(ii) and (b)(iv)
It is suggested that \(\Delta L\) , \(L\) , \(T\) and \(T_0\) are related by
where \(k\) is a constant
Using your data, calculate two values for \(k\)
first value of \(k =\)

It is suggested that the percentage uncertainty in the values of \(k\) is \(30\%\)
Using this uncertainty, explain whether your results support the relationship in (d)

Describe **four** sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment. For any uncertainties in measurement that you describe, you should state the quantity being measured and the reason for the uncertainty
Describe **four** improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
[Total: 20]
You may not need to use all of the materials provided
In this experiment, you will investigate the thermal properties of plastic pipe
